parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/View.php

docblock.description: View in order to render test presentation page
docblock.long-description:
This class is used as a view component in our simple MVC pattern, where model is {@link phpRack_Runner}, view is {@link phpRack_View} and controller is a simple script in {@link bootstrap.php}. An instance of this class is accepting variables and a script name in order to render it, for example:

$view = new phpRack_View();
$view->assign(array('name' => 'My Name To Render'));
$html = $view->render('index.phtml');

In this example, you can access "name" inside "index.phtml" like this: $this->name.
Variables from this array can be used inside view script, just as local class variables. It is implemented by {@link __get()}

docblock.description: Getter dispatcher, used inside view script

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Adapters/Shell/Command.php

docblock.description: Shell command adapter used to execute external commands and programs
Pipe ids, used for select with which process pipe we want to communicate
Process resource returned by proc_open() used for process identification
Shell command factory, to simplify calls
Execute shell command. Use asynchronous pipes to communicate with child process
docblock.long-description:
We must pass custom env from _getEnv() method to to proc_open() call, because on phprack.com server. When we execute external php file from other process, script make some strange forks and execute itself many times. This behavior results server internal error.

shell_exec() is also affected by this issue, we have earlier this problem, and was solved by adding "env -i" before shell command. Recently we have added PEAR support, which internally execute PHP script, so problem returned.

Direct reason of this error is $_ENV['PATH'] variable. When we unset it and pass modified env to proc_open(). It works on Windows XP, Ubuntu Linux and solve problem on phprack.com server. But from some reason on MacOS there is some problem with this env value reseting, and we lose some privilege? Due to this fact, our unit tests fail, because PEAR test produce error:

touch(): Unable to create file /opt/local/lib/php/.lock
because Permission denied in /usr/local/PEAR/PEAR/Registry.php
on line 835

If we pass null to proc_open() env param we have no problems on MacOS, but problem on phprack.com still exists.

That is reason why we must pass to this function custom env param.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if from some reason command can't be executed

docblock.description: Get env which should be passed to proc_open()

docblock.long-description: After that PHP can detect connection status. If it was closed objects destructors will be automatically executed and script stop work.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Adapters/File.php

docblock.description: Create an instance of this class
Converts file name from any form possible to an absolute path
docblock.long-description:
For example, you can use it like this, inside any package:

// convert it to PHPRACK_PATH . '/../test.php'
$file = $this->_convertFileName('/../test.php');
// returns '/home/my/test.php'
$file = $this->_convertFileName('/home/my/test.php');
// returns 'c:/Windows/System32/my.dll'
$file = $this->_convertFileName('c:/Windows/System32/my.dll');

If the file not found, it doesn't affect the result of this method. The result always contain an absolute path of the file. This method doesn't do any operations with the file, just re-constructs its name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: File name, as it is provided (raw form)

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Package/Php.php

docblock.description: Check php.ini param with expected value
docblock.long-description:
Good example:

class MyTest extends phpRack_Test {
  public fuction testPhpIni() {
    $this->assert->php->ini('short_open_tag');
  }
}

Example:

class MyTest extends phpRack_Test {
  public fuction testPhpIniAtleast() {
    $this->assert->php->ini('memory_limit')->atLeast('128M');
  }
}

docblock.description: Check files in directory have correct php syntax
docblock.long-description:
Possible options are:

class MyTest extends phpRack_Test {
  public function testCodeValidity() {
    $this->assert->php->lint(
      '/home/myproject/php', // path to PHP files
      array(
        'extensions' => 'php,phtml', // comma-separated list of extensions to parse
        'exclude' => array('/\.svn/'), // list of RegExps to exclude
        'verbose' => true, // show detailed log, with one file per line
      )
    );
  }
}

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Package.php

docblock.long-description:
The package is used from your custom integration test, through the instance of {@link phpRack_Assertion} class, which is available like this:

class MyTest extends phpRack_Test {
  public function testPhpVersion() {
    $this->assert->php->version->atLeast('5.2');
  }
}

In this example package {@link phpRack_Package_Php_Version} will be instantiated and returned. Later, method atLeast() will be called in this package.

tag.name: var
tag.description: TRUE means that the latest call was successful

docblock.long-description:
The method is PROTECTED in order to avoid direct instantiation of packages outside our factory method {@link factory()}. Some packages may override the method, that's why it is protected, not private. For example {@link phpRack_Package_Db_Mysql}.

phpRack_Result passed here as parameter is used as a holder of test results. This package will ADD new results to this holder, instead of creating new one. This holder is passed from {@link phpRack_Test}, normally.

The method is called factory, but this is not really a static factory. This method just simplifies the instantiation of phpRack_Package and encapsulates private constructor. Some time ago we had a static factory here, but then removed it. The organization of methods stay like before (factory + private constructor). Maybe in the future we might decide to introduce static factory again.

Here we create a sub-package, for example:

// inside your instance of phpRack_Test:
$this->assert->php->extensions->isLoaded('simplexml');

The call in the example will lead you to this method, and will call __get('extensions'). In return we will create an instance of phpRack_Package_Php_Extensions and return it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the property to get

tag.name: param
tag.description: What to do? STRING will log this string

tag.name: param
tag.description: What to do? STRING will log this string

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Runner.php

docblock.description: Run all tests together, or one by one
docblock.long-description:
First you should create an instance of this class, providing it an array of options. Then you can either run individual test or all tests in a test suite:

$runner = new phpRack_Runner(array('dir'=>'/path/to/my-tests'));
echo $runner->runSuite();

This code will give you a plain-text report of all tests in your collection, executed and logged.

docblock.description: This is how you should name your test files, if you want them to be found by the Runner
This is how you should name your suite files, if you want them to be found by the Runner
List of options, which are changeable

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to set to the class

docblock.description: We're running the tests in CLI environment?
Check whether client connection has enough security level?
Get full list of tests, in array
docblock.long-description:
This method builds a list of phpRack_Test class instances, collecting them from integration 1) tests and 2) suites. They both are located in the same directory (pre-configured in $phpRackConfig), but differ only in file name suffix. Integration test ends with "...Test.php" and integration suite ends with "...Suite.php".

Suite is an integration of tests, that allows you to use library tests and suites. The majority of testing tasks are similar from server to server. If you want to avoid manual development of tests for every application, just use our library suites, and taylor them for your application needs.

docblock.description: Run all tests and return a text report about their execution
Run one test and return JSON result

tag.name: param
tag.description: Test file name (absolute name of PHP file)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Unique token to return back, if required

tag.description: Associative array of options to be used for setAjaxOptions()

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Now we work only with one notifier, which is in class phpRack_Mail. Later we should add other notifiers, like SMS, IRC, ICQ, etc. When we add them we should move our phpRack_Mail class to phpRack_Notifier_Mail and create other notifiers there.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Assertion.php

docblock.long-description: There is a combination of static factory() method and a private constructor. However we don't have any static factory here, just an incapsulation of constructor. Some time ago we had a static factory, but then removed it. Maybe in the future we might get back to this design approach.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Test that is using this assertion

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the package to get

docblock.long-description:
This magic method will be called when you're using any assertion and some method inside it, for example:

// inside your instance of phpRack_Test:
$this->assert->php->extensions->isLoaded('simplexml');

The call in the example will lead you to this method, and will call __call('simplexml', array()).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the method to call

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/bootstrap.php
No page-level DocBlock was found in file phpRack/Suite.php

docblock.description: Parent class of all test suites
docblock.long-description: Suites are maintained as directories full of tests, inside "phpRack/Suite/library" holder. When we {@link _addSuite()}, this class files all tests in this suite directory and add them all to itself. Also, library contains individual tests, which can be added to the suite by means of {@link _addTest()}.

docblock.description: Create new instance of the class, using PHP absolute file name

tag.name: param
tag.description: ID of the suite, absolute (!) file name

docblock.description: Get tests defined in this suite and sub suites
Allow child class to add tests and sub suites by overwritting this method

docblock.long-description: Suite is a collection of tests. Name of the suite ($suiteName) is a name of directory in "phpRack/Suite/library".
Test should be located in our test library, inside "phpRack/Suite/library" directory, and should be inherited from {@link phpRack_Suite_Test} class.
